class.name: VisualServer
class.description: Server for anything visible. The visual server is the API backend for everything visible. The whole scene system mounts on it to display. The visual server is completely opaque, the internals are entirely implementation specific and cannot be accessed. The visual server can be used to bypass the scene system entirely. Resources are created using the [code]*_create[/code] functions. All objects are drawn to a viewport. You can use the [Viewport] attached to the [SceneTree] or you can create one yourself with [method viewport_create]. When using a custom scenario or canvas, the scenario or canvas needs to be attached to the viewport using [method viewport_set_scenario] or [method viewport_attach_canvas]. In 3D, all visual objects must be associated with a scenario. The scenario is a visual representation of the world. If accessing the visual server from a running game, the scenario can be accessed from the scene tree from any [Spatial] node with [method Spatial.get_world]. Otherwise, a scenario can be created with [method scenario_create]. Similarly, in 2D, a canvas is needed to draw all canvas items. In 3D, all visible objects are comprised of a resource and an instance. A resource can be a mesh, a particle system, a light, or any other 3D object. In order to be visible resources must be attached to an instance using [method instance_set_base]. The instance must also be attached to the scenario using [method instance_set_scenario] in order to be visible. In 2D, all visible objects are some form of canvas item. In order to be visible, a canvas item needs to be the child of a canvas attached to a viewport, or it needs to be the child of another canvas item that is eventually attached to the canvas.

method.name: black_bars_set_images
method.description: Sets images to be rendered in the window margin.

method.name: black_bars_set_margins
method.description: Sets margin size, where black bars (or images, if [method black_bars_set_images] was used) are rendered.

method.name: camera_create
method.description: Creates a camera and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]camera_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method.

method.name: camera_set_cull_mask
method.description: Sets the cull mask associated with this camera. The cull mask describes which 3D layers are rendered by this camera. Equivalent to [member Camera.cull_mask].

method.name: camera_set_environment
method.description: Sets the environment used by this camera. Equivalent to [member Camera.environment].

method.name: camera_set_frustum
method.description: Sets camera to use frustum projection. This mode allows adjusting the [code]offset[/code] argument to create "tilted frustum" effects.

method.name: camera_set_orthogonal
method.description: Sets camera to use orthogonal projection, also known as orthographic projection. Objects remain the same size on the screen no matter how far away they are.

method.name: camera_set_perspective
method.description: Sets camera to use perspective projection. Objects on the screen becomes smaller when they are far away.

method.name: camera_set_transform
method.description: Sets [Transform] of camera.

method.name: camera_set_use_vertical_aspect
method.description: If [code]true[/code], preserves the horizontal aspect ratio which is equivalent to [constant Camera.KEEP_WIDTH]. If [code]false[/code], preserves the vertical aspect ratio which is equivalent to [constant Camera.KEEP_HEIGHT].

method.name: canvas_create
method.description: Creates a canvas and returns the assigned [RID]. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]canvas_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method.

method.name: canvas_item_add_circle
method.description: Adds a circle command to the [CanvasItem]'s draw commands.

method.name: canvas_item_add_clip_ignore
method.description: If ignore is [code]true[/code], the VisualServer does not perform clipping.

method.name: canvas_item_add_line
method.description: Adds a line command to the [CanvasItem]'s draw commands.

method.name: canvas_item_add_mesh
method.description: Adds a mesh command to the [CanvasItem]'s draw commands.

method.name: canvas_item_add_multimesh
method.description: Adds a [MultiMesh] to the [CanvasItem]'s draw commands. Only affects its aabb at the moment.

method.name: canvas_item_add_nine_patch
method.description: Adds a nine patch image to the [CanvasItem]'s draw commands. See [NinePatchRect] for more explanation.

method.name: canvas_item_add_particles
method.description: Adds a particle system to the [CanvasItem]'s draw commands.

method.name: canvas_item_add_polygon
method.description: Adds a polygon to the [CanvasItem]'s draw commands.

method.name: canvas_item_add_polyline
method.description: Adds a polyline, which is a line from multiple points with a width, to the [CanvasItem]'s draw commands.

method.name: canvas_item_add_primitive
method.description: Adds a primitive to the [CanvasItem]'s draw commands.

method.name: canvas_item_add_rect
method.description: Adds a rectangle to the [CanvasItem]'s draw commands.

method.name: canvas_item_add_set_transform
method.description: Adds a [Transform2D] command to the [CanvasItem]'s draw commands. This sets the extra_matrix uniform when executed. This affects the later commands of the canvas item.

method.name: canvas_item_add_texture_rect
method.description: Adds a textured rect to the [CanvasItem]'s draw commands.

method.name: canvas_item_add_texture_rect_region
method.description: Adds a texture rect with region setting to the [CanvasItem]'s draw commands.

method.name: canvas_item_add_triangle_array
method.description: Adds a triangle array to the [CanvasItem]'s draw commands.

method.name: canvas_item_clear
method.description: Clears the [CanvasItem] and removes all commands in it.

method.name: canvas_item_create
method.description: Creates a new [CanvasItem] and returns its [RID]. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]canvas_item_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method.

method.name: canvas_item_set_clip
method.description: Sets clipping for the [CanvasItem].

method.name: canvas_item_set_copy_to_backbuffer
method.description: Sets the [CanvasItem] to copy a rect to the backbuffer.

method.name: canvas_item_set_custom_rect
method.description: Defines a custom drawing rectangle for the [CanvasItem].

method.name: canvas_item_set_distance_field_mode
method.description: Enables the use of distance fields for GUI elements that are rendering distance field based fonts.

method.name: canvas_item_set_draw_behind_parent
method.description: Sets [CanvasItem] to be drawn behind its parent.

method.name: canvas_item_set_draw_index
method.description: Sets the index for the [CanvasItem].

method.name: canvas_item_set_light_mask
method.description: The light mask. See [LightOccluder2D] for more information on light masks.

method.name: canvas_item_set_material
method.description: Sets a new material to the [CanvasItem].

method.name: canvas_item_set_modulate
method.description: Sets the color that modulates the [CanvasItem] and its children.

method.name: canvas_item_set_parent
method.description: Sets the parent for the [CanvasItem]. The parent can be another canvas item, or it can be the root canvas that is attached to the viewport.

method.name: canvas_item_set_self_modulate
method.description: Sets the color that modulates the [CanvasItem] without children.

method.name: canvas_item_set_sort_children_by_y
method.description: Sets if [CanvasItem]'s children should be sorted by y-position.

method.name: canvas_item_set_transform
method.description: Sets the [CanvasItem]'s [Transform2D].

method.name: canvas_item_set_use_parent_material
method.description: Sets if the [CanvasItem] uses its parent's material.

method.name: canvas_item_set_visible
method.description: Sets if the canvas item (including its children) is visible.

method.name: canvas_item_set_z_as_relative_to_parent
method.description: If this is enabled, the Z index of the parent will be added to the children's Z index.

method.name: canvas_item_set_z_index
method.description: Sets the [CanvasItem]'s Z index, i.e. its draw order (lower indexes are drawn first).

method.name: canvas_light_attach_to_canvas
method.description: Attaches the canvas light to the canvas. Removes it from its previous canvas.

method.name: canvas_light_create
method.description: Creates a canvas light and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]canvas_light_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method.

method.name: canvas_light_occluder_attach_to_canvas
method.description: Attaches a light occluder to the canvas. Removes it from its previous canvas.

method.name: canvas_light_occluder_create
method.description: Creates a light occluder and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]canvas_light_ocluder_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method.

method.name: canvas_light_occluder_set_enabled
method.description: Enables or disables light occluder.

method.name: canvas_light_occluder_set_light_mask
method.description: The light mask. See [LightOccluder2D] for more information on light masks.

method.name: canvas_light_occluder_set_polygon
method.description: Sets a light occluder's polygon.

method.name: canvas_light_occluder_set_transform
method.description: Sets a light occluder's [Transform2D].

method.name: canvas_light_set_color
method.description: Sets the color for a light.

method.name: canvas_light_set_enabled
method.description: Enables or disables a canvas light.

method.name: canvas_light_set_energy
method.description: Sets a canvas light's energy.

method.name: canvas_light_set_height
method.description: Sets a canvas light's height.

method.name: canvas_light_set_item_cull_mask
method.description: The light mask. See [LightOccluder2D] for more information on light masks.

method.name: canvas_light_set_item_shadow_cull_mask
method.description: The binary mask used to determine which layers this canvas light's shadows affects. See [LightOccluder2D] for more information on light masks.

method.name: canvas_light_set_layer_range
method.description: The layer range that gets rendered with this light.

method.name: canvas_light_set_mode
method.description: The mode of the light, see [enum CanvasLightMode] constants.

method.name: canvas_light_set_scale
method.description: Sets the texture's scale factor of the light. Equivalent to [member Light2D.texture_scale].

method.name: canvas_light_set_shadow_buffer_size
method.description: Sets the width of the shadow buffer, size gets scaled to the next power of two for this.

method.name: canvas_light_set_shadow_color
method.description: Sets the color of the canvas light's shadow.

method.name: canvas_light_set_shadow_enabled
method.description: Enables or disables the canvas light's shadow.

method.name: canvas_light_set_shadow_filter
method.description: Sets the canvas light's shadow's filter, see [enum CanvasLightShadowFilter] constants.

method.name: canvas_light_set_shadow_gradient_length
method.description: Sets the length of the shadow's gradient.

method.name: canvas_light_set_shadow_smooth
method.description: Smoothens the shadow. The lower, the smoother.

method.name: canvas_light_set_texture
method.description: Sets texture to be used by light. Equivalent to [member Light2D.texture].

method.name: canvas_light_set_texture_offset
method.description: Sets the offset of the light's texture. Equivalent to [member Light2D.offset].

method.name: canvas_light_set_transform
method.description: Sets the canvas light's [Transform2D].

method.name: canvas_light_set_z_range
method.description: Sets the Z range of objects that will be affected by this light. Equivalent to [member Light2D.range_z_min] and [member Light2D.range_z_max].

method.name: canvas_occluder_polygon_create
method.description: Creates a new light occluder polygon and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]canvas_occluder_polygon_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method.

method.name: canvas_occluder_polygon_set_cull_mode
method.description: Sets an occluder polygons cull mode. See [enum CanvasOccluderPolygonCullMode] constants.

method.name: canvas_occluder_polygon_set_shape
method.description: Sets the shape of the occluder polygon.

method.name: canvas_occluder_polygon_set_shape_as_lines
method.description: Sets the shape of the occluder polygon as lines.

method.name: canvas_set_item_mirroring
method.description: A copy of the canvas item will be drawn with a local offset of the mirroring [Vector2].

method.name: canvas_set_modulate
method.description: Modulates all colors in the given canvas.

method.name: directional_light_create
method.description: Creates a directional light and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID can be used in most [code]light_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method. To place in a scene, attach this directional light to an instance using [method instance_set_base] using the returned RID.

method.name: draw
method.description: Draws a frame. [i]This method is deprecated[/i], please use [method force_draw] instead.

method.name: environment_create
method.description: Creates an environment and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]environment_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method.

method.name: environment_set_adjustment
method.description: Sets the values to be used with the "Adjustment" post-process effect. See [Environment] for more details.

method.name: environment_set_ambient_light
method.description: Sets the ambient light parameters. See [Environment] for more details.

method.name: environment_set_background
method.description: Sets the [i]BGMode[/i] of the environment. Equivalent to [member Environment.background_mode].

method.name: environment_set_bg_color
method.description: Color displayed for clear areas of the scene (if using Custom color or Color+Sky background modes).

method.name: environment_set_bg_energy
method.description: Sets the intensity of the background color.

method.name: environment_set_canvas_max_layer
method.description: Sets the maximum layer to use if using Canvas background mode.

method.name: environment_set_dof_blur_far
method.description: Sets the values to be used with the "DoF Far Blur" post-process effect. See [Environment] for more details.

method.name: environment_set_dof_blur_near
method.description: Sets the values to be used with the "DoF Near Blur" post-process effect. See [Environment] for more details.

method.name: environment_set_fog
method.description: Sets the variables to be used with the scene fog. See [Environment] for more details.

method.name: environment_set_fog_depth
method.description: Sets the variables to be used with the fog depth effect. See [Environment] for more details.

method.name: environment_set_fog_height
method.description: Sets the variables to be used with the fog height effect. See [Environment] for more details.

method.name: environment_set_glow
method.description: Sets the variables to be used with the "glow" post-process effect. See [Environment] for more details.

method.name: environment_set_sky
method.description: Sets the [Sky] to be used as the environment's background when using [i]BGMode[/i] sky. Equivalent to [member Environment.background_sky].

method.name: environment_set_sky_custom_fov
method.description: Sets a custom field of view for the background [Sky]. Equivalent to [member Environment.background_sky_custom_fov].

method.name: environment_set_sky_orientation
method.description: Sets the rotation of the background [Sky] expressed as a [Basis]. Equivalent to [member Environment.background_sky_orientation].

method.name: environment_set_ssao
method.description: Sets the variables to be used with the "Screen Space Ambient Occlusion (SSAO)" post-process effect. See [Environment] for more details.

method.name: environment_set_ssr
method.description: Sets the variables to be used with the "screen space reflections" post-process effect. See [Environment] for more details.

method.name: environment_set_tonemap
method.description: Sets the variables to be used with the "tonemap" post-process effect. See [Environment] for more details.

method.name: finish
method.description: Removes buffers and clears testcubes.

method.name: force_draw
method.description: Forces a frame to be drawn when the function is called. Drawing a frame updates all [Viewport]s that are set to update. Use with extreme caution.

method.name: force_sync
method.description: Synchronizes threads.

method.name: free_rid
method.description: Tries to free an object in the VisualServer.

method.name: get_render_info
method.description: Returns a certain information, see [enum RenderInfo] for options.

method.name: get_test_cube
method.description: Returns the id of the test cube. Creates one if none exists.

method.name: get_test_texture
method.description: Returns the id of the test texture. Creates one if none exists.

method.name: get_video_adapter_name
method.description: Returns the name of the video adapter (e.g. "GeForce GTX 1080/PCIe/SSE2"). [b]Note:[/b] When running a headless or server binary, this function returns an empty string.

method.name: get_video_adapter_vendor
method.description: Returns the vendor of the video adapter (e.g. "NVIDIA Corporation"). [b]Note:[/b] When running a headless or server binary, this function returns an empty string.

method.name: get_white_texture
method.description: Returns the id of a white texture. Creates one if none exists.

method.name: gi_probe_create
method.description: Creates a GI probe and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]gi_probe_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method. To place in a scene, attach this GI probe to an instance using [method instance_set_base] using the returned RID.

method.name: gi_probe_get_bias
method.description: Returns the bias value for the GI probe. Bias is used to avoid self occlusion. Equivalent to [member GIProbeData.bias].

method.name: gi_probe_get_bounds
method.description: Returns the axis-aligned bounding box that covers the full extent of the GI probe.

method.name: gi_probe_get_cell_size
method.description: Returns the cell size set by [method gi_probe_set_cell_size].

method.name: gi_probe_get_dynamic_data
method.description: Returns the data used by the GI probe.

method.name: gi_probe_get_dynamic_range
method.description: Returns the dynamic range set for this GI probe. Equivalent to [member GIProbe.dynamic_range].

method.name: gi_probe_get_energy
method.description: Returns the energy multiplier for this GI probe. Equivalent to [member GIProbe.energy].

method.name: gi_probe_get_normal_bias
method.description: Returns the normal bias for this GI probe. Equivalent to [member GIProbe.normal_bias].

method.name: gi_probe_get_propagation
method.description: Returns the propagation value for this GI probe. Equivalent to [member GIProbe.propagation].

method.name: gi_probe_get_to_cell_xform
method.description: Returns the Transform set by [method gi_probe_set_to_cell_xform].

method.name: gi_probe_is_compressed
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the GI probe data associated with this GI probe is compressed. Equivalent to [member GIProbe.compress].

method.name: gi_probe_is_interior
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the GI probe is set to interior, meaning it does not account for sky light. Equivalent to [member GIProbe.interior].

method.name: gi_probe_set_bias
method.description: Sets the bias value to avoid self-occlusion. Equivalent to [member GIProbe.bias].

method.name: gi_probe_set_bounds
method.description: Sets the axis-aligned bounding box that covers the extent of the GI probe.

method.name: gi_probe_set_cell_size
method.description: Sets the size of individual cells within the GI probe.

method.name: gi_probe_set_compress
method.description: Sets the compression setting for the GI probe data. Compressed data will take up less space but may look worse. Equivalent to [member GIProbe.compress].

method.name: gi_probe_set_dynamic_data
method.description: Sets the data to be used in the GI probe for lighting calculations. Normally this is created and called internally within the [GIProbe] node. You should not try to set this yourself.

method.name: gi_probe_set_dynamic_range
method.description: Sets the dynamic range of the GI probe. Dynamic range sets the limit for how bright lights can be. A smaller range captures greater detail but limits how bright lights can be. Equivalent to [member GIProbe.dynamic_range].

method.name: gi_probe_set_energy
method.description: Sets the energy multiplier for this GI probe. A higher energy makes the indirect light from the GI probe brighter. Equivalent to [member GIProbe.energy].

method.name: gi_probe_set_interior
method.description: Sets the interior value of this GI probe. A GI probe set to interior does not include the sky when calculating lighting. Equivalent to [member GIProbe.interior].

method.name: gi_probe_set_normal_bias
method.description: Sets the normal bias for this GI probe. Normal bias behaves similar to the other form of bias and may help reduce self-occlusion. Equivalent to [member GIProbe.normal_bias].

method.name: gi_probe_set_propagation
method.description: Sets the propagation of light within this GI probe. Equivalent to [member GIProbe.propagation].

method.name: gi_probe_set_to_cell_xform
method.description: Sets the to cell [Transform] for this GI probe.

method.name: has_changed
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if changes have been made to the VisualServer's data. [method draw] is usually called if this happens.

method.name: has_feature
method.description: Not yet implemented. Always returns [code]false[/code].

method.name: has_os_feature
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the OS supports a certain feature. Features might be [code]s3tc[/code], [code]etc[/code], [code]etc2[/code], [code]pvrtc[/code] and [code]skinning_fallback[/code]. When rendering with GLES2, returns [code]true[/code] with [code]skinning_fallback[/code] in case the hardware doesn't support the default GPU skinning process.

method.name: immediate_begin
method.description: Sets up [ImmediateGeometry] internals to prepare for drawing. Equivalent to [method ImmediateGeometry.begin].

method.name: immediate_clear
method.description: Clears everything that was set up between [method immediate_begin] and [method immediate_end]. Equivalent to [method ImmediateGeometry.clear].

method.name: immediate_color
method.description: Sets the color to be used with next vertex. Equivalent to [method ImmediateGeometry.set_color].

method.name: immediate_create
method.description: Creates an immediate geometry and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]immediate_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method. To place in a scene, attach this immediate geometry to an instance using [method instance_set_base] using the returned RID.

method.name: immediate_end
method.description: Ends drawing the [ImmediateGeometry] and displays it. Equivalent to [method ImmediateGeometry.end].

method.name: immediate_get_material
method.description: Returns the material assigned to the [ImmediateGeometry].

method.name: immediate_normal
method.description: Sets the normal to be used with next vertex. Equivalent to [method ImmediateGeometry.set_normal].

method.name: immediate_set_material
method.description: Sets the material to be used to draw the [ImmediateGeometry].

method.name: immediate_tangent
method.description: Sets the tangent to be used with next vertex. Equivalent to [method ImmediateGeometry.set_tangent].

method.name: immediate_uv
method.description: Sets the UV to be used with next vertex. Equivalent to [method ImmediateGeometry.set_uv].

method.name: immediate_uv2
method.description: Sets the UV2 to be used with next vertex. Equivalent to [method ImmediateGeometry.set_uv2].

method.name: immediate_vertex
method.description: Adds the next vertex using the information provided in advance. Equivalent to [method ImmediateGeometry.add_vertex].

method.name: immediate_vertex_2d
method.description: Adds the next vertex using the information provided in advance. This is a helper class that calls [method immediate_vertex] under the hood. Equivalent to [method ImmediateGeometry.add_vertex].

method.name: init
method.description: Initializes the visual server. This function is called internally by platform-dependent code during engine initialization. If called from a running game, it will not do anything.

method.name: instance_attach_object_instance_id
method.description: Attaches a unique Object ID to instance. Object ID must be attached to instance for proper culling with [method instances_cull_aabb], [method instances_cull_convex], and [method instances_cull_ray].

method.name: instance_attach_skeleton
method.description: Attaches a skeleton to an instance. Removes the previous skeleton from the instance.

method.name: instance_create
method.description: Creates a visual instance and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]instance_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method. An instance is a way of placing a 3D object in the scenario. Objects like particles, meshes, and reflection probes need to be associated with an instance to be visible in the scenario using [method instance_set_base].

method.name: instance_create2
method.description: Creates a visual instance, adds it to the VisualServer, and sets both base and scenario. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]instance_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method.

method.name: instance_geometry_set_as_instance_lod
method.description: Not implemented in Godot 3.x.

method.name: instance_geometry_set_cast_shadows_setting
method.description: Sets the shadow casting setting to one of [enum ShadowCastingSetting]. Equivalent to [member GeometryInstance.cast_shadow].

method.name: instance_geometry_set_draw_range
method.description: Not implemented in Godot 3.x.

method.name: instance_geometry_set_flag
method.description: Sets the flag for a given [enum InstanceFlags]. See [enum InstanceFlags] for more details.

method.name: instance_geometry_set_material_override
method.description: Sets a material that will override the material for all surfaces on the mesh associated with this instance. Equivalent to [member GeometryInstance.material_override].

method.name: instance_set_base
method.description: Sets the base of the instance. A base can be any of the 3D objects that are created in the VisualServer that can be displayed. For example, any of the light types, mesh, multimesh, immediate geometry, particle system, reflection probe, lightmap capture, and the GI probe are all types that can be set as the base of an instance in order to be displayed in the scenario.

method.name: instance_set_blend_shape_weight
method.description: Sets the weight for a given blend shape associated with this instance.

method.name: instance_set_custom_aabb
method.description: Sets a custom AABB to use when culling objects from the view frustum. Equivalent to [method GeometryInstance.set_custom_aabb].

method.name: instance_set_exterior
method.description: Function not implemented in Godot 3.x.

method.name: instance_set_extra_visibility_margin
method.description: Sets a margin to increase the size of the AABB when culling objects from the view frustum. This allows you to avoid culling objects that fall outside the view frustum. Equivalent to [member GeometryInstance.extra_cull_margin].

method.name: instance_set_layer_mask
method.description: Sets the render layers that this instance will be drawn to. Equivalent to [member VisualInstance.layers].

method.name: instance_set_scenario
method.description: Sets the scenario that the instance is in. The scenario is the 3D world that the objects will be displayed in.

method.name: instance_set_surface_material
method.description: Sets the material of a specific surface. Equivalent to [method MeshInstance.set_surface_material].

method.name: instance_set_transform
method.description: Sets the world space transform of the instance. Equivalent to [member Spatial.transform].

method.name: instance_set_use_lightmap
method.description: Sets the lightmap to use with this instance.

method.name: instance_set_visible
method.description: Sets whether an instance is drawn or not. Equivalent to [member Spatial.visible].

method.name: instances_cull_aabb
method.description: Returns an array of object IDs intersecting with the provided AABB. Only visual 3D nodes are considered, such as [MeshInstance] or [DirectionalLight]. Use [method @GDScript.instance_from_id] to obtain the actual nodes. A scenario RID must be provided, which is available in the [World] you want to query. This forces an update for all resources queued to update. [b]Warning:[/b] This function is primarily intended for editor usage. For in-game use cases, prefer physics collision.

method.name: instances_cull_convex
method.description: Returns an array of object IDs intersecting with the provided convex shape. Only visual 3D nodes are considered, such as [MeshInstance] or [DirectionalLight]. Use [method @GDScript.instance_from_id] to obtain the actual nodes. A scenario RID must be provided, which is available in the [World] you want to query. This forces an update for all resources queued to update. [b]Warning:[/b] This function is primarily intended for editor usage. For in-game use cases, prefer physics collision.

method.name: instances_cull_ray
method.description: Returns an array of object IDs intersecting with the provided 3D ray. Only visual 3D nodes are considered, such as [MeshInstance] or [DirectionalLight]. Use [method @GDScript.instance_from_id] to obtain the actual nodes. A scenario RID must be provided, which is available in the [World] you want to query. This forces an update for all resources queued to update. [b]Warning:[/b] This function is primarily intended for editor usage. For in-game use cases, prefer physics collision.

method.name: light_directional_set_blend_splits
method.description: If [code]true[/code], this directional light will blend between shadow map splits resulting in a smoother transition between them. Equivalent to [member DirectionalLight.directional_shadow_blend_splits].

method.name: light_directional_set_shadow_depth_range_mode
method.description: Sets the shadow depth range mode for this directional light. Equivalent to [member DirectionalLight.directional_shadow_depth_range]. See [enum LightDirectionalShadowDepthRangeMode] for options.

method.name: light_directional_set_shadow_mode
method.description: Sets the shadow mode for this directional light. Equivalent to [member DirectionalLight.directional_shadow_mode]. See [enum LightDirectionalShadowMode] for options.

method.name: light_omni_set_shadow_detail
method.description: Sets whether to use vertical or horizontal detail for this omni light. This can be used to alleviate artifacts in the shadow map. Equivalent to [member OmniLight.omni_shadow_detail].

method.name: light_omni_set_shadow_mode
method.description: Sets whether to use a dual paraboloid or a cubemap for the shadow map. Dual paraboloid is faster but may suffer from artifacts. Equivalent to [member OmniLight.omni_shadow_mode].

method.name: light_set_bake_mode
method.description: Sets the bake mode for this light, see [enum LightBakeMode] for options. The bake mode affects how the light will be baked in [BakedLightmap]s and [GIProbe]s.

method.name: light_set_color
method.description: Sets the color of the light. Equivalent to [member Light.light_color].

method.name: light_set_cull_mask
method.description: Sets the cull mask for this Light. Lights only affect objects in the selected layers. Equivalent to [member Light.light_cull_mask].

method.name: light_set_negative
method.description: If [code]true[/code], light will subtract light instead of adding light. Equivalent to [member Light.light_negative].

method.name: light_set_param
method.description: Sets the specified light parameter. See [enum LightParam] for options. Equivalent to [method Light.set_param].

method.name: light_set_projector
method.description: Not implemented in Godot 3.x.

method.name: light_set_reverse_cull_face_mode
method.description: If [code]true[/code], reverses the backface culling of the mesh. This can be useful when you have a flat mesh that has a light behind it. If you need to cast a shadow on both sides of the mesh, set the mesh to use double sided shadows with [method instance_geometry_set_cast_shadows_setting]. Equivalent to [member Light.shadow_reverse_cull_face].

method.name: light_set_shadow
method.description: If [code]true[/code], light will cast shadows. Equivalent to [member Light.shadow_enabled].

method.name: light_set_shadow_color
method.description: Sets the color of the shadow cast by the light. Equivalent to [member Light.shadow_color].

method.name: light_set_use_gi
method.description: Sets whether GI probes capture light information from this light. [i]Deprecated method.[/i] Use [method light_set_bake_mode] instead. This method is only kept for compatibility reasons and calls [method light_set_bake_mode] internally, setting the bake mode to [constant LIGHT_BAKE_DISABLED] or [constant LIGHT_BAKE_INDIRECT] depending on the given parameter.

method.name: lightmap_capture_create
method.description: Creates a lightmap capture and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]lightmap_capture_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method. To place in a scene, attach this lightmap capture to an instance using [method instance_set_base] using the returned RID.

method.name: lightmap_capture_get_bounds
method.description: Returns the size of the lightmap capture area.

method.name: lightmap_capture_get_energy
method.description: Returns the energy multiplier used by the lightmap capture.

method.name: lightmap_capture_get_octree
method.description: Returns the octree used by the lightmap capture.

method.name: lightmap_capture_get_octree_cell_subdiv
method.description: Returns the cell subdivision amount used by this lightmap capture's octree.

method.name: lightmap_capture_get_octree_cell_transform
method.description: Returns the cell transform for this lightmap capture's octree.

method.name: lightmap_capture_is_interior
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if capture is in "interior" mode.

method.name: lightmap_capture_set_bounds
method.description: Sets the size of the area covered by the lightmap capture. Equivalent to [member BakedLightmapData.bounds].

method.name: lightmap_capture_set_energy
method.description: Sets the energy multiplier for this lightmap capture. Equivalent to [member BakedLightmapData.energy].

method.name: lightmap_capture_set_interior
method.description: Sets the "interior" mode for this lightmap capture. Equivalent to [member BakedLightmapData.interior].

method.name: lightmap_capture_set_octree
method.description: Sets the octree to be used by this lightmap capture. This function is normally used by the [BakedLightmap] node. Equivalent to [member BakedLightmapData.octree].

method.name: lightmap_capture_set_octree_cell_subdiv
method.description: Sets the subdivision level of this lightmap capture's octree. Equivalent to [member BakedLightmapData.cell_subdiv].

method.name: lightmap_capture_set_octree_cell_transform
method.description: Sets the octree cell transform for this lightmap capture's octree. Equivalent to [member BakedLightmapData.cell_space_transform].

method.name: make_sphere_mesh
method.description: Returns a mesh of a sphere with the given amount of horizontal and vertical subdivisions.

method.name: material_create
method.description: Creates an empty material and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]material_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method.

method.name: material_get_param
method.description: Returns the value of a certain material's parameter.

method.name: material_get_param_default
method.description: Returns the default value for the param if available. Otherwise returns an empty [Variant].

method.name: material_get_shader
method.description: Returns the shader of a certain material's shader. Returns an empty RID if the material doesn't have a shader.

method.name: material_set_line_width
method.description: Sets a material's line width.

method.name: material_set_next_pass
method.description: Sets an object's next material.

method.name: material_set_param
method.description: Sets a material's parameter.

method.name: material_set_render_priority
method.description: Sets a material's render priority.

method.name: material_set_shader
method.description: Sets a shader material's shader.

method.name: mesh_add_surface_from_arrays
method.description: Adds a surface generated from the Arrays to a mesh. See [enum PrimitiveType] constants for types.

method.name: mesh_clear
method.description: Removes all surfaces from a mesh.

method.name: mesh_create
method.description: Creates a new mesh and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]mesh_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method. To place in a scene, attach this mesh to an instance using [method instance_set_base] using the returned RID.

method.name: mesh_get_blend_shape_count
method.description: Returns a mesh's blend shape count.

method.name: mesh_get_blend_shape_mode
method.description: Returns a mesh's blend shape mode.

method.name: mesh_get_custom_aabb
method.description: Returns a mesh's custom aabb.

method.name: mesh_get_surface_count
method.description: Returns a mesh's number of surfaces.

method.name: mesh_remove_surface
method.description: Removes a mesh's surface.

method.name: mesh_set_blend_shape_count
method.description: Sets a mesh's blend shape count.

method.name: mesh_set_blend_shape_mode
method.description: Sets a mesh's blend shape mode.

method.name: mesh_set_custom_aabb
method.description: Sets a mesh's custom aabb.

method.name: mesh_surface_get_aabb
method.description: Returns a mesh's surface's aabb.

method.name: mesh_surface_get_array
method.description: Returns a mesh's surface's vertex buffer.

method.name: mesh_surface_get_array_index_len
method.description: Returns a mesh's surface's amount of indices.

method.name: mesh_surface_get_array_len
method.description: Returns a mesh's surface's amount of vertices.

method.name: mesh_surface_get_arrays
method.description: Returns a mesh's surface's buffer arrays.

method.name: mesh_surface_get_blend_shape_arrays
method.description: Returns a mesh's surface's arrays for blend shapes.

method.name: mesh_surface_get_format
method.description: Returns the format of a mesh's surface.

method.name: mesh_surface_get_format_offset
method.description: Function is unused in Godot 3.x.

method.name: mesh_surface_get_index_array
method.description: Returns a mesh's surface's index buffer.

method.name: mesh_surface_get_material
method.description: Returns a mesh's surface's material.

method.name: mesh_surface_get_primitive_type
method.description: Returns the primitive type of a mesh's surface.

method.name: mesh_surface_get_skeleton_aabb
method.description: Returns the aabb of a mesh's surface's skeleton.

method.name: mesh_surface_set_material
method.description: Sets a mesh's surface's material.

method.name: mesh_surface_update_region
method.description: Updates a specific region of a vertex buffer for the specified surface. Warning: this function alters the vertex buffer directly with no safety mechanisms, you can easily corrupt your mesh.

method.name: multimesh_allocate
method.description: Allocates space for the multimesh data. Format parameters determine how the data will be stored by OpenGL. See [enum MultimeshTransformFormat], [enum MultimeshColorFormat], and [enum MultimeshCustomDataFormat] for usage. Equivalent to [member MultiMesh.instance_count].

method.name: multimesh_create
method.description: Creates a new multimesh on the VisualServer and returns an [RID] handle. This RID will be used in all [code]multimesh_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method. To place in a scene, attach this multimesh to an instance using [method instance_set_base] using the returned RID.

method.name: multimesh_get_aabb
method.description: Calculates and returns the axis-aligned bounding box that encloses all instances within the multimesh.

method.name: multimesh_get_instance_count
method.description: Returns the number of instances allocated for this multimesh.

method.name: multimesh_get_mesh
method.description: Returns the RID of the mesh that will be used in drawing this multimesh.

method.name: multimesh_get_visible_instances
method.description: Returns the number of visible instances for this multimesh.

method.name: multimesh_instance_get_color
method.description: Returns the color by which the specified instance will be modulated.

method.name: multimesh_instance_get_custom_data
method.description: Returns the custom data associated with the specified instance.

method.name: multimesh_instance_get_transform
method.description: Returns the [Transform] of the specified instance.

method.name: multimesh_instance_get_transform_2d
method.description: Returns the [Transform2D] of the specified instance. For use when the multimesh is set to use 2D transforms.

method.name: multimesh_instance_set_color
method.description: Sets the color by which this instance will be modulated. Equivalent to [method MultiMesh.set_instance_color].

method.name: multimesh_instance_set_custom_data
method.description: Sets the custom data for this instance. Custom data is passed as a [Color], but is interpreted as a [code]vec4[/code] in the shader. Equivalent to [method MultiMesh.set_instance_custom_data].

method.name: multimesh_instance_set_transform
method.description: Sets the [Transform] for this instance. Equivalent to [method MultiMesh.set_instance_transform].

method.name: multimesh_instance_set_transform_2d
method.description: Sets the [Transform2D] for this instance. For use when multimesh is used in 2D. Equivalent to [method MultiMesh.set_instance_transform_2d].

method.name: multimesh_set_as_bulk_array
method.description:
Sets all data related to the instances in one go. This is especially useful when loading the data from disk or preparing the data from GDNative.
All data is packed in one large float array. An array may look like this: Transform for instance 1, color data for instance 1, custom data for instance 1, transform for instance 2, color data for instance 2, etc.
[Transform] is stored as 12 floats, [Transform2D] is stored as 8 floats, [code]COLOR_8BIT[/code] / [code]CUSTOM_DATA_8BIT[/code] is stored as 1 float (4 bytes as is) and [code]COLOR_FLOAT[/code] / [code]CUSTOM_DATA_FLOAT[/code] is stored as 4 floats.

method.name: multimesh_set_mesh
method.description: Sets the mesh to be drawn by the multimesh. Equivalent to [member MultiMesh.mesh].

method.name: multimesh_set_visible_instances
method.description: Sets the number of instances visible at a given time. If -1, all instances that have been allocated are drawn. Equivalent to [member MultiMesh.visible_instance_count].

method.name: omni_light_create
method.description: Creates a new omni light and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID can be used in most [code]light_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method. To place in a scene, attach this omni light to an instance using [method instance_set_base] using the returned RID.

method.name: particles_create
method.description: Creates a particle system and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]particles_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method. To place in a scene, attach these particles to an instance using [method instance_set_base] using the returned RID.

method.name: particles_get_current_aabb
method.description: Calculates and returns the axis-aligned bounding box that contains all the particles. Equivalent to [method Particles.capture_aabb].

method.name: particles_get_emitting
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if particles are currently set to emitting.

method.name: particles_is_inactive
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if particles are not emitting and particles are set to inactive.

method.name: particles_request_process
method.description: Add particle system to list of particle systems that need to be updated. Update will take place on the next frame, or on the next call to [method instances_cull_aabb], [method instances_cull_convex], or [method instances_cull_ray].

method.name: particles_restart
method.description: Reset the particles on the next update. Equivalent to [method Particles.restart].

method.name: particles_set_amount
method.description: Sets the number of particles to be drawn and allocates the memory for them. Equivalent to [member Particles.amount].

method.name: particles_set_custom_aabb
method.description: Sets a custom axis-aligned bounding box for the particle system. Equivalent to [member Particles.visibility_aabb].

method.name: particles_set_draw_order
method.description: Sets the draw order of the particles to one of the named enums from [enum ParticlesDrawOrder]. See [enum ParticlesDrawOrder] for options. Equivalent to [member Particles.draw_order].

method.name: particles_set_draw_pass_mesh
method.description: Sets the mesh to be used for the specified draw pass. Equivalent to [member Particles.draw_pass_1], [member Particles.draw_pass_2], [member Particles.draw_pass_3], and [member Particles.draw_pass_4].

method.name: particles_set_draw_passes
method.description: Sets the number of draw passes to use. Equivalent to [member Particles.draw_passes].

method.name: particles_set_emission_transform
method.description: Sets the [Transform] that will be used by the particles when they first emit.

method.name: particles_set_emitting
method.description: If [code]true[/code], particles will emit over time. Setting to false does not reset the particles, but only stops their emission. Equivalent to [member Particles.emitting].

method.name: particles_set_explosiveness_ratio
method.description: Sets the explosiveness ratio. Equivalent to [member Particles.explosiveness].

method.name: particles_set_fixed_fps
method.description: Sets the frame rate that the particle system rendering will be fixed to. Equivalent to [member Particles.fixed_fps].

method.name: particles_set_fractional_delta
method.description: If [code]true[/code], uses fractional delta which smooths the movement of the particles. Equivalent to [member Particles.fract_delta].

method.name: particles_set_lifetime
method.description: Sets the lifetime of each particle in the system. Equivalent to [member Particles.lifetime].

method.name: particles_set_one_shot
method.description: If [code]true[/code], particles will emit once and then stop. Equivalent to [member Particles.one_shot].

method.name: particles_set_pre_process_time
method.description: Sets the preprocess time for the particles' animation. This lets you delay starting an animation until after the particles have begun emitting. Equivalent to [member Particles.preprocess].

method.name: particles_set_process_material
method.description: Sets the material for processing the particles. [b]Note:[/b] This is not the material used to draw the materials. Equivalent to [member Particles.process_material].

method.name: particles_set_randomness_ratio
method.description: Sets the emission randomness ratio. This randomizes the emission of particles within their phase. Equivalent to [member Particles.randomness].

method.name: particles_set_speed_scale
method.description: Sets the speed scale of the particle system. Equivalent to [member Particles.speed_scale].

method.name: particles_set_use_local_coordinates
method.description: If [code]true[/code], particles use local coordinates. If [code]false[/code] they use global coordinates. Equivalent to [member Particles.local_coords].

method.name: reflection_probe_create
method.description: Creates a reflection probe and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]reflection_probe_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method. To place in a scene, attach this reflection probe to an instance using [method instance_set_base] using the returned RID.

method.name: reflection_probe_set_as_interior
method.description: If [code]true[/code], reflections will ignore sky contribution. Equivalent to [member ReflectionProbe.interior_enable].

method.name: reflection_probe_set_cull_mask
method.description: Sets the render cull mask for this reflection probe. Only instances with a matching cull mask will be rendered by this probe. Equivalent to [member ReflectionProbe.cull_mask].

method.name: reflection_probe_set_enable_box_projection
method.description: If [code]true[/code], uses box projection. This can make reflections look more correct in certain situations. Equivalent to [member ReflectionProbe.box_projection].

method.name: reflection_probe_set_enable_shadows
method.description: If [code]true[/code], computes shadows in the reflection probe. This makes the reflection much slower to compute. Equivalent to [member ReflectionProbe.enable_shadows].

method.name: reflection_probe_set_extents
method.description: Sets the size of the area that the reflection probe will capture. Equivalent to [member ReflectionProbe.extents].

method.name: reflection_probe_set_intensity
method.description: Sets the intensity of the reflection probe. Intensity modulates the strength of the reflection. Equivalent to [member ReflectionProbe.intensity].

method.name: reflection_probe_set_interior_ambient
method.description: Sets the ambient light color for this reflection probe when set to interior mode. Equivalent to [member ReflectionProbe.interior_ambient_color].

method.name: reflection_probe_set_interior_ambient_energy
method.description: Sets the energy multiplier for this reflection probes ambient light contribution when set to interior mode. Equivalent to [member ReflectionProbe.interior_ambient_energy].

method.name: reflection_probe_set_interior_ambient_probe_contribution
method.description: Sets the contribution value for how much the reflection affects the ambient light for this reflection probe when set to interior mode. Useful so that ambient light matches the color of the room. Equivalent to [member ReflectionProbe.interior_ambient_contrib].

method.name: reflection_probe_set_max_distance
method.description: Sets the max distance away from the probe an object can be before it is culled. Equivalent to [member ReflectionProbe.max_distance].

method.name: reflection_probe_set_origin_offset
method.description: Sets the origin offset to be used when this reflection probe is in box project mode. Equivalent to [member ReflectionProbe.origin_offset].

method.name: reflection_probe_set_update_mode
method.description: Sets how often the reflection probe updates. Can either be once or every frame. See [enum ReflectionProbeUpdateMode] for options.

method.name: request_frame_drawn_callback
method.description: Schedules a callback to the corresponding named [code]method[/code] on [code]where[/code] after a frame has been drawn. The callback method must use only 1 argument which will be called with [code]userdata[/code].

method.name: scenario_create
method.description: Creates a scenario and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]scenario_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method. The scenario is the 3D world that all the visual instances exist in.

method.name: scenario_set_debug
method.description: Sets the [enum ScenarioDebugMode] for this scenario. See [enum ScenarioDebugMode] for options.

method.name: scenario_set_environment
method.description: Sets the environment that will be used with this scenario.

method.name: scenario_set_fallback_environment
method.description: Sets the fallback environment to be used by this scenario. The fallback environment is used if no environment is set. Internally, this is used by the editor to provide a default environment.

method.name: scenario_set_reflection_atlas_size
method.description: Sets the size of the reflection atlas shared by all reflection probes in this scenario.

method.name: set_boot_image
method.description: Sets a boot image. The color defines the background color. If [code]scale[/code] is [code]true[/code], the image will be scaled to fit the screen size. If [code]use_filter[/code] is [code]true[/code], the image will be scaled with linear interpolation. If [code]use_filter[/code] is [code]false[/code], the image will be scaled with nearest-neighbor interpolation.

method.name: set_debug_generate_wireframes
method.description: If [code]true[/code], the engine will generate wireframes for use with the wireframe debug mode.

method.name: set_default_clear_color
method.description: Sets the default clear color which is used when a specific clear color has not been selected.

method.name: set_shader_time_scale
method.description: Sets the scale to apply to the passage of time for the shaders' [code]TIME[/code] builtin. The default value is [code]1.0[/code], which means [code]TIME[/code] will count the real time as it goes by, without narrowing or stretching it.

method.name: set_use_occlusion_culling
method.description: Enables or disables occlusion culling.

method.name: shader_create
method.description: Creates an empty shader and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]shader_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method.

method.name: shader_get_code
method.description: Returns a shader's code.

method.name: shader_get_default_texture_param
method.description: Returns a default texture from a shader searched by name.

method.name: shader_get_param_list
method.description: Returns the parameters of a shader.

method.name: shader_set_code
method.description: Sets a shader's code.

method.name: shader_set_default_texture_param
method.description: Sets a shader's default texture. Overwrites the texture given by name.

method.name: skeleton_allocate
method.description: Allocates the GPU buffers for this skeleton.

method.name: skeleton_bone_get_transform
method.description: Returns the [Transform] set for a specific bone of this skeleton.

method.name: skeleton_bone_get_transform_2d
method.description: Returns the [Transform2D] set for a specific bone of this skeleton.

method.name: skeleton_bone_set_transform
method.description: Sets the [Transform] for a specific bone of this skeleton.

method.name: skeleton_bone_set_transform_2d
method.description: Sets the [Transform2D] for a specific bone of this skeleton.

method.name: skeleton_create
method.description: Creates a skeleton and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]skeleton_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method.

method.name: skeleton_get_bone_count
method.description: Returns the number of bones allocated for this skeleton.

method.name: sky_create
method.description: Creates an empty sky and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]sky_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method.

method.name: sky_set_texture
method.description: Sets a sky's texture.

method.name: spot_light_create
method.description: Creates a spot light and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID can be used in most [code]light_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method. To place in a scene, attach this spot light to an instance using [method instance_set_base] using the returned RID.

method.name: sync
method.description: Not implemented in Godot 3.x.

method.name: texture_allocate
method.description: Allocates the GPU memory for the texture.

method.name: texture_bind
method.description: Binds the texture to a texture slot.

method.name: texture_create
method.description: Creates an empty texture and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]texture_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method.

method.name: texture_create_from_image
method.description: Creates a texture, allocates the space for an image, and fills in the image.

method.name: texture_debug_usage
method.description: Returns a list of all the textures and their information.

method.name: texture_get_data
method.description: Returns a copy of a texture's image unless it's a CubeMap, in which case it returns the [RID] of the image at one of the cubes sides.

method.name: texture_get_depth
method.description: Returns the depth of the texture.

method.name: texture_get_flags
method.description: Returns the flags of a texture.

method.name: texture_get_format
method.description: Returns the format of the texture's image.

method.name: texture_get_height
method.description: Returns the texture's height.

method.name: texture_get_path
method.description: Returns the texture's path.

method.name: texture_get_texid
method.description: Returns the opengl id of the texture's image.

method.name: texture_get_type
method.description: Returns the type of the texture, can be any of the [enum TextureType].

method.name: texture_get_width
method.description: Returns the texture's width.

method.name: texture_set_data
method.description: Sets the texture's image data. If it's a CubeMap, it sets the image data at a cube side.

method.name: texture_set_data_partial
method.description: Sets a part of the data for a texture. Warning: this function calls the underlying graphics API directly and may corrupt your texture if used improperly.

method.name: texture_set_flags
method.description: Sets the texture's flags. See [enum TextureFlags] for options.

method.name: texture_set_path
method.description: Sets the texture's path.

method.name: texture_set_shrink_all_x2_on_set_data
method.description: If [code]true[/code], sets internal processes to shrink all image data to half the size.

method.name: texture_set_size_override
method.description: Resizes the texture to the specified dimensions.

method.name: textures_keep_original
method.description: If [code]true[/code], the image will be stored in the texture's images array if overwritten.

method.name: viewport_attach_camera
method.description: Sets a viewport's camera.

method.name: viewport_attach_canvas
method.description: Sets a viewport's canvas.

method.name: viewport_attach_to_screen
method.description: Copies viewport to a region of the screen specified by [code]rect[/code]. If [member Viewport.render_direct_to_screen] is [code]true[/code], then viewport does not use a framebuffer and the contents of the viewport are rendered directly to screen. However, note that the root viewport is drawn last, therefore it will draw over the screen. Accordingly, you must set the root viewport to an area that does not cover the area that you have attached this viewport to. For example, you can set the root viewport to not render at all with the following code: [codeblock] func _ready(): get_viewport().set_attach_to_screen_rect(Rect2()) $Viewport.set_attach_to_screen_rect(Rect2(0, 0, 600, 600)) [/codeblock] Using this can result in significant optimization, especially on lower-end devices. However, it comes at the cost of having to manage your viewports manually. For a further optimization see, [method viewport_set_render_direct_to_screen].

method.name: viewport_create
method.description: Creates an empty viewport and adds it to the VisualServer. It can be accessed with the RID that is returned. This RID will be used in all [code]viewport_*[/code] VisualServer functions. Once finished with your RID, you will want to free the RID using the VisualServer's [method free_rid] static method.

method.name: viewport_detach
method.description: Detaches the viewport from the screen.

method.name: viewport_get_render_info
method.description: Returns a viewport's render information. For options, see the [enum ViewportRenderInfo] constants.

method.name: viewport_get_texture
method.description: Returns the viewport's last rendered frame.

method.name: viewport_remove_canvas
method.description: Detaches a viewport from a canvas and vice versa.

method.name: viewport_set_active
method.description: If [code]true[/code], sets the viewport active, else sets it inactive.

method.name: viewport_set_canvas_stacking
method.description: Sets the stacking order for a viewport's canvas. [code]layer[/code] is the actual canvas layer, while [code]sublayer[/code] specifies the stacking order of the canvas among those in the same layer.

method.name: viewport_set_canvas_transform
method.description: Sets the transformation of a viewport's canvas.

method.name: viewport_set_clear_mode
method.description: Sets the clear mode of a viewport. See [enum ViewportClearMode] for options.

method.name: viewport_set_debug_draw
method.description: Sets the debug draw mode of a viewport. See [enum ViewportDebugDraw] for options.

method.name: viewport_set_disable_3d
method.description: If [code]true[/code], a viewport's 3D rendering is disabled.

method.name: viewport_set_disable_environment
method.description: If [code]true[/code], rendering of a viewport's environment is disabled.

method.name: viewport_set_global_canvas_transform
method.description: Sets the viewport's global transformation matrix.

method.name: viewport_set_hdr
method.description: If [code]true[/code], the viewport renders to hdr.

method.name: viewport_set_hide_canvas
method.description: If [code]true[/code], the viewport's canvas is not rendered.

method.name: viewport_set_hide_scenario
method.description: Currently unimplemented in Godot 3.x.

method.name: viewport_set_msaa
method.description: Sets the anti-aliasing mode. See [enum ViewportMSAA] for options.

method.name: viewport_set_parent_viewport
method.description: Sets the viewport's parent to another viewport.

method.name: viewport_set_render_direct_to_screen
method.description: If [code]true[/code], render the contents of the viewport directly to screen. This allows a low-level optimization where you can skip drawing a viewport to the root viewport. While this optimization can result in a significant increase in speed (especially on older devices), it comes at a cost of usability. When this is enabled, you cannot read from the viewport or from the [code]SCREEN_TEXTURE[/code]. You also lose the benefit of certain window settings, such as the various stretch modes. Another consequence to be aware of is that in 2D the rendering happens in window coordinates, so if you have a viewport that is double the size of the window, and you set this, then only the portion that fits within the window will be drawn, no automatic scaling is possible, even if your game scene is significantly larger than the window size.

method.name: viewport_set_scenario
method.description: Sets a viewport's scenario. The scenario contains information about the [enum ScenarioDebugMode], environment information, reflection atlas etc.

method.name: viewport_set_shadow_atlas_quadrant_subdivision
method.description: Sets the shadow atlas quadrant's subdivision.

method.name: viewport_set_shadow_atlas_size
method.description: Sets the size of the shadow atlas's images (used for omni and spot lights). The value will be rounded up to the nearest power of 2.

method.name: viewport_set_sharpen_intensity
method.description: Sets the sharpening [code]intensity[/code] for the [code]viewport[/code]. If set to a value greater than [code]0.0[/code], contrast-adaptive sharpening will be applied to the 3D viewport. This has a low performance cost and can be used to recover some of the sharpness lost from using FXAA. Values around [code]0.5[/code] generally give the best results. See also [method viewport_set_use_fxaa].

method.name: viewport_set_size
method.description: Sets the viewport's width and height.

method.name: viewport_set_transparent_background
method.description: If [code]true[/code], the viewport renders its background as transparent.

method.name: viewport_set_update_mode
method.description: Sets when the viewport should be updated. See [enum ViewportUpdateMode] constants for options.

method.name: viewport_set_usage
method.description: Sets the viewport's 2D/3D mode. See [enum ViewportUsage] constants for options.

method.name: viewport_set_use_arvr
method.description: If [code]true[/code], the viewport uses augmented or virtual reality technologies. See [ARVRInterface].

method.name: viewport_set_use_debanding
method.description: If [code]true[/code], uses a fast post-processing filter to make banding significantly less visible. In some cases, debanding may introduce a slightly noticeable dithering pattern. It's recommended to enable debanding only when actually needed since the dithering pattern will make lossless-compressed screenshots larger. [b]Note:[/b] Only available on the GLES3 backend. [member Viewport.hdr] must also be [code]true[/code] for debanding to be effective.

method.name: viewport_set_use_fxaa
method.description: Enables fast approximate antialiasing for this viewport. FXAA is a popular screen-space antialiasing method, which is fast but will make the image look blurry, especially at lower resolutions. It can still work relatively well at large resolutions such as 1440p and 4K. Some of the lost sharpness can be recovered by enabling contrast-adaptive sharpening (see [method viewport_set_sharpen_intensity]).

method.name: viewport_set_vflip
method.description: If [code]true[/code], the viewport's rendering is flipped vertically.

members.member: If [code]false[/code], disables rendering completely, but the engine logic is still being processed. You can call [method force_draw] to draw a frame even with rendering disabled.

signal.name: frame_post_draw
signal.description: Emitted at the end of the frame, after the VisualServer has finished updating all the Viewports.

signal.name: frame_pre_draw
signal.description: Emitted at the beginning of the frame, before the VisualServer updates all the Viewports.
